Cells were centrifuged for 5 min at 200g and resuspended in mTeSR1, filtered through a 20-μm strainer and washed with mTeSR1. Cells were then centrifuged again for 5 min at 200g and resuspended in mTeSR1, counted, diluted to the same concentration and mixed at equal ratios for the three cell lines to be loaded on the 10x microfluidic chip aiming for 10,000 cells.
units.rationale: Specifies the initial enzymatic treatment of cells.

units.title: Loading cells onto 10x microfluidic chip and cDNA synthesis
units.text: In brief, cells were mixed with reverse transcription mix, gel beads and oil were loaded on the chip device to be coencapsulated into droplets, which underwent first strand cDNA synthesis thereby tagging mRNAs with a UMI and a unique cell barcode.
units.rationale: Details the droplet generation and molecular barcoding step.

units.title: Organoid washing, fixation and cryoprotection
units.text: Organoids were washed in PBS before fixing in 4% PFA ... The excess of fixative was removed with three PBS washes and organoids were then transferred to a 30% sucrose solution for 24–48 h for cryoprotection.
units.rationale: Covers fixation and preparation for downstream sectioning.

units.title: Embedding and snap‑freezing of organoids
units.text: Finally, organoids were transferred to plastic cryomolds (Tissue Tek) and embed... in OCT compound 4583 (Tissue Tek) for snap-freezing on dry ice.
units.rationale: Describes embedding and preservation of tissue for sectioning.
